meanings.sent1: The antigenicities of the virus helped the body fight it off.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the antigenicities of different pathogens to develop vaccines.
meanings.sent3: The antigenicities of the bacteria made them stand out like colorful balloons in a black-and-white world.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the antigenicities of a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The antigenicities of the flower's scent attracted bees from afar.

meanings.definition: The ability to stimulate an immune response.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the antigenicities of a substance helps predict its effect on the immune system.
meanings.sent2: Vaccines work by mimicking the antigenicities of harmful viruses to train the immune system.
meanings.sent3: The antigenicities of the new medicine were so persuasive, they convinced the immune system to take action.
meanings.sent4: His words had the antigenicities of a battle cry, rallying the immune system to defend the body.
meanings.sent5: The antigenicities of the alarm clock woke up the immune system to start the day.

meanings.definition: The property of being recognized by the immune system as foreign.
meanings.sent1: The antigenicities of the invader triggered the immune system's defense mechanisms.
meanings.sent2: Allergies occur when the body mistakes harmless substances for antigenicities.
meanings.sent3: The antigenicities of the alien spaceship confused the immune system, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: The antigenicities of the spy were so convincing that the immune system launched a full-scale attack.
meanings.sent5: The antigenicities of the counterfeit bill fooled the immune system into treating it as a threat.
